content.en: Metal artifact reduction: Researchers from various institutions and publishers have been investigating the effectiveness of different algorithms in reducing metal artifacts in medical imaging, particularly in CT scans of the head and neck. These algorithms, developed by organizations such as the Institute of Physics and Engineering in Medicine, Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, and John Wiley & Sons, aim to improve image quality and diagnostic confidence in radiation therapy treatment planning. The studies also explore the impact of these algorithms on reducing artifacts from dental implants and dental materials.
content.da: Reduktion af metalartefakter: Forskere fra forskellige institutioner og forlag har undersøgt effektiviteten af forskellige algoritmer til at reducere metalartefakter i medicinsk billeddannelse, især i CT-scanninger af hoved og hals. Disse algoritmer, udviklet af organisationer som Institute of Physics and Engineering in Medicine, Lippincott Williams & Wilkins og John Wiley & Sons, har til formål at forbedre billedkvalitet og diagnostisk tillid i planlægning af strålebehandling. Studierne undersøger også, hvordan disse algoritmer kan reducere artefakter fra tandimplantater og tandmaterialer.
